news.title: Introducing the MCP
news.subtitle: A new standard for connecting AI assistants to the systems where data lives, including content repositories, business tools, and development environments.

news.title: MCP Specification
news.subtitle: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) follows a client-host-server architecture where each host can run multiple client instances.

news.title: Remote MCP Servers
news.subtitle: Build and deploy Remote Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to Cloudflare. It creates the opportunity to reach a wider audience of Internet users who are not going to install and run MCP servers locally for use with desktop apps.

news.title: MCP Servers
news.subtitle: A collection of reference implementations for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), as well as references to community built servers and additional resources.

news.title: UV
news.subtitle: An extremely fast Python package and project manager, written in Rust. A single tool to replace pip, pip-tools, pipx, poetry, pyenv, twine, virtualenv, and more.

news.title: Node.js
news.subtitle: Node.jsÂ® is a free, open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that lets developers create servers, web apps, command line tools and scripts.

news.title: Desktop Extensions
news.subtitle: Desktop Extensions (.dxt/.mcpb files) solve these problems by bundling an entire MCP server, including all dependencies into a single installable package.

news.title: TUUI
news.subtitle: Official website for Tool Unitary UI. A desktop LLM chat client designed as MCP integration, accelerating AI adoption through the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and enabling cross-vendor LLM API orchestration

news.title: AIQL
news.subtitle: AIQL.com provides a suite of tools designed to streamline the development and deployment of AI applications in a cloud-native environment.

news.title: API Proxy
news.subtitle: API proxy enabling seamless LLM API access by resolving cross-origin and blocking issues, simplifying and streamlining model interaction.
